nodes.text: We are committed to free and open competition in our markets. We compete fairly and ethically, and support laws that promote and protect competition.
We never discuss or agree to boycott a customer or a supplier with our competitors.  Doing so can be a criminal offence resulting in heavy penalties and prosecution.
Report any suspicion or evidence of this behaviour immediately to your legal team.
Do not discuss boycotting customers or suppliers or any other competitively sensitive information any further.  Leave the meeting or the event if it is happening.

Giving an unearned reward to influence someone’s behaviour or making an irregular payment to win business is a form of bribery.  It is illegal.  This includes being asked for a fee by a supplier to win a contract or business. This is and could be interpreted by others as a bribe.
We do not offer, give or receive bribes or make improper payments, or participate in any kind of corrupt activity, either directly or through any third party.

Engaging in any form of bribery or corruption, even an allegation, can result in criminal proscecution and can seriously damage our reputation and our business relationships and is never acceptable.  We would rather miss out on business than take this risk.
Do not pay.  Take action immediately. Report the situation to your line manager and the legal department.
Record any details of the request (time, date, by whom and how it was asked for).

Any type of facilitation payment is prohibited, large or small. Even where such payments are perceived as a common practice and even if our competitors engage in such practices, no violations of this principle will be tolerated.
Continue to resist any demand for this kind of payment. Say no and use the examples to help you.
